Definition: from an unused root meaning to cover; a cove (as a sheltered bay); coast (of the sea), haven, shore, (sea-) side.
from the same as {{h2348}}; protection; Chupham, an Israelite; Hupham.
from {{h2342}}; sand (as round or whirling particles); sand.
from an unused root meaning to be warm, i.e. (by implication); sunburnt or swarthy (blackish); brown.
feminine active participle of an unused root apparently meaning to join; a wall of protection; wall, walled.
a primitive root; properly, to cover, i.e. (figuratively) to compassionate; pity, regard, spare.
perhaps from {{h2333}}; a villager; a Chivvite, one of the aboriginal tribes of Palestine; Hivite.
probably from {{h2342}}; circular; Chavilah, the name of two or three eastern regions; also perhaps of two men; Havilah.

or חִיל; a primitive root; properly, to twist or whirl (in a circular or spiral manner), i.e. (specifically) to dance, to writhe in pain (especially of parturition) or fear; figuratively, to wait, to pervert; bear, (make to) bring forth, (make to) calve, dance, drive away, fall grievously (with pain), fear, form, great, grieve, (be) grievous, hope, look, make, be in pain, be much (sore) pained, rest, shake, shapen, (be) sorrow(-ful), stay, tarry, travail (with pain), tremble, trust, wait carefully (patiently), be wounded.
from {{h2342}}; a circle; Chul, a son of Aram; also the region settled by him; Hul.
from an unused root probably meaning to sew; a string; by implication, a measuring tape; cord, fillet, line, thread.
(Aramaic) corresponding to the root of {{h2339}}, perhaps as a denominative; to string together, i.e. (figuratively) to repair; join.
a primitive root; (compare {{h2324}}, {{h2421}}); properly, to live; by implication (intensively) to declare or show; show.
a primitive root; properly, to tie a knot, i.e. (figuratively) to propound a riddle; put forth.
properly, the same as {{h2332}} (life-giving, i.e. living-place); by implication, an encampment or village; (small) town.
causatively from {{h2331}}; life-giver; Chavvah (or Eve), the first woman; Eve.
from {{h2374}}; visionary; Chozai, an Israelite; the seers.
from the plural of {{h2333}} and a modification of {{h3265}}; hamlets of Jair, a region of Palestine; (Bashan-) Havoth-jair.
perhaps the same as {{h2336}}; a dell or crevice (as if pierced in the earth); thicket.
from an unused root apparently meaning to pierce; a thorn; by analogy, a ring for the nose; bramble, thistle, thorn.
a primitive root (compare {{h2287}}); to describe a circle; compass.
from {{h2328}}; a circle; circle, circuit, compass.
feminine of {{h2319}}; new; Chadashah, a place in Palestine; Hadashah.
(Aramaic) corresponding to {{h2319}}; new; new.
from {{h2318}}; the new moon; by implication, a month; month(-ly), new moon.
the same as {{h2320}}; Chodesh, an Israelitess; Hodesh.
from {{h2325}}; debt; debtor.
feminine active participle of {{h2247}}; hiding place; Chobah, a place in Syria; Hobah.
(Aramaic) corresponding to {{h2331}}; to show; shew.
also חָיַב; a primitive root; properly, perhaps to tie, i.e. (figuratively and reflexively) to owe, or (by implication) to forfeit; make endanger.
from {{h2398}}; a crime or its penalty; fault, × grievously, offence, (punishment of) sin.

a primitive root; properly, to miss; hence (figuratively and generally) to sin; by inference, to forfeit, lack, expiate, repent, (causatively) lead astray, condemn; bear the blame, cleanse, commit (sin), by fault, harm he hath done, loss, miss, (make) offend(-er), offer for sin, purge, purify (self), make reconciliation, (cause, make) sin(-ful, -ness), trespass.
once (Ezekiel 29:4) חָחִי; from the same as {{h2336}}; a ring for the nose (or lips); bracelet, chain, hook.

or חִזְקִיָּהוּ; also יְחִזְקִיָּה; or יְחִזְקִיָּהוּ; from {{h2388}} and {{h3050}}; strengthened of Jah; Chizkijah, a king of Judah, also the name of two other Israelites; Hezekiah, Hizkiah, Hizkijah. Compare {{h3169}}.
from {{h2388}}; strong; Chizki, an Israelite; Hezeki.
feminine of {{h2392}}; vehemence (usually in a bad sense); force, mightily, repair, sharply.
feminine of {{h2391}}; prevailing power; strength(-en self), (was) strong.
from {{h2388}}; power; strength.
from {{h2388}}; help; strength.
from {{h2388}}; powerful; × wax louder, stronger.
of uncertain derivation; Chadrak, a Syrian deity; Hadrach.
another form for {{h2315}}; chamber; Chadar, an Ishmaelite; Hadar.
from {{h2314}}; an apartment (usually literal); ((bed) inner) chamber, innermost(-ward) part, parlour,   south, × within.
a primitive root; properly, to inclose (as a room), i.e. (by analogy,) to beset (as in a siege); enter a privy chamber.
probably of foreign origin; the Chiddekel (or Tigris) river; Hiddekel.
from an unused root meaning to sting; a prickly plant; brier, thorn.
from {{h2309}}; idle; Chadlai, an Israelite; Hadlai.
from {{h2308}}; vacant, i.e. ceasing or destitute; he that forbeareth, frail, rejected.
from {{h2318}}; new; fresh, new thing.
a primitive root; to be new; causatively, to rebuild; renew, repair.

a primitive root; to fasten upon; hence, to seize, be strong (figuratively, courageous, causatively strengthen, cure, help, repair, fortify), obstinate; to bind, restrain, conquer; aid, amend, × calker, catch, cleave, confirm, be constant, constrain, continue, be of good (take) courage(-ous, -ly), encourage (self), be established, fasten, force, fortify, make hard, harden, help, (lay) hold (fast), lean, maintain, play the man, mend, become (wax) mighty, prevail, be recovered, repair, retain, seize, be (wax) sore, strengthen (self), be stout, be (make, shew, wax) strong(-er), be sure, take (hold), be urgent, behave self valiantly, withstand.
from {{h2388}}; strong (usu. in a bad sense, hard, bold, violent); harder, hottest,   impudent, loud, mighty, sore, stiff(-hearted), strong(-er).
from {{h2372}}; a look; hence (figuratively) striking appearance, revelation, or (by implication) compact; agreement, notable (one), vision.
from {{h2372}} and {{h410}}; seen of God; Chaziel, a Levite; Haziel.
from {{h2372}} and {{h3050}}; Jah has seen; Chazajah, an Israelite; Hazaiah.
from {{h2372}}; vision; Chezjon, a Syrian; Hezion.
from {{h2372}}; a revelation, expectation by dream; vision.
from an unused root meaning to glare; a flash of lightning; bright cloud, lightning.
from an unused root probably meaning to inclose; a hog (perhaps as penned); boar, swine.
from the same as {{h2386}}; perhaps protected; Chezir, the name of two Israelites; Hezir.
from {{h2300}}; fierce; Chadad, an Ishmaelite; Hadad.
a primitive root; to rejoice; make glad, be joined, rejoice.
from {{h2300}}; a point; sharp.
from {{h2302}}; rejoicing; gladness, joy.
(Aramaic) corresponding to {{h2304}}; joy.
(Aramaic) corresponding to {{h2373}}; a breast; breast.
from {{h2300}}; a peak; Chadid, a place in Palestine; Hadid.
a primitive root; properly, to be flabby, i.e. (by implication) desist; (figuratively) be lacking or idle; cease, end, fall, forbear, forsake, leave (off), let alone, rest, be unoccupied, want.
from {{h2308}}; rest, i.e. the state of the dead; world.
intensively from {{h2398}}; a criminal, or one accounted guilty; offender, sinful, sinner.
from {{h2372}}; seer; Chazo, a nephew of Abraham; Hazo.
active participle of {{h2372}}; a beholder in vision; also a compact (as looked upon with approval); agreement, prophet, see that, seer, (star-) gazer.
from {{h2372}}; a sight (mentally), i.e. a dream, revelation, or oracle; vision.
(Aramaic) from {{h2370}}; a sight; look, vision.
or חֲזָהאֵל; from {{h2372}} and {{h410}}; God has seen; Chazael, a king of Syria; Hazael.
(Aramaic) or חֲזָה; (Aramaic), corresponding to {{h2372}}; to gaze upon; mentally to dream, be usual (i.e. seem); behold, have (a dream), see, be wont.
from {{h2372}}; the breast (as most seen in front); breast.
a primitive root; to gaze at; mentally to perceive, contemplate (with pleasure); specifically, to have a vision of; behold, look, prophesy, provide, see.
(Aramaic) from {{h2370}}; a view; sight.
from {{h2372}}; a revelation; vision.
or חֻשִׁים; or חֻשִׁם; plural from {{h2363}}; hasters; Chushim, the name of three Israelites; Hushim.
or חֻשָׁם; from {{h2363}}; hastily; Chusham, an Idumaean; Husham.
from {{h2363}}; haste; Chushah, an Israelite; Hushah.
from {{h2363}}; hasty; Chushai, an Israelite; Hushai.
apparently from {{h2357}} (in the sense of {{h2352}}); cavernous; Chavran, a region East of the Jordan; Hauran.
a primitive root; to hurry; figuratively, to be eager with excitement or enjoyment; (make) haste(-n), ready.
probably an orthographical variation for {{h2359}}; Churai, an Israelite; Hurai.
probably from {{h2353}}; whiteness, i.e. noble; Churam, the name of an Israelite and two Syrians; Huram. Compare {{h2438}}.
or חֹתָם; from {{h2856}}; a signature-ring; seal, signet.
the same as {{h2368}}; seal; Chotham, the name of two Israelites; Hotham, Hothan.
from {{h2357}}; white linen; white.
or (shortened) חֻר; from an unused root probably meaning to bore; the crevice of a serpent; the cell of a prison; hole.

or (shortened) חֻץ; (both forms feminine in the plural) from an unused root meaning to sever; properly, separate by a wall, i.e. outside, outdoors; abroad, field, forth, highway, more, out(-side, -ward), street, without.
patronymically from {{h2349}}; a Chuphamite or descendant of Chupham; Huphamites.
a primitive root; to blanch (as with shame); wax pale.
or (shortened) חֹר; the same as {{h2352}}; a cavity, socket, den; cave, hole.
the same as {{h2353}}; white linen; network. Compare {{h2715}}.
the same as {{h2353}} or {{h2352}}; Chur, the name of four Israelites and one Midianite; Hur.
probably from {{h2353}}; linen-worker; Churi, an Israelite; Huri.
(Aramaic) from a root corresponding to {{h2357}}; white; white.
